verses.text: I \add am\add* the man \add that\add* hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.
He hath led me, and brought \add me into\add* darkness , but not \add into\add* light.
Surely against me is he turned ; he turneth his hand \add against me\add* all the day.
My flesh and my skin hath he made old ; he hath broken my bones.
He hath builded against me, and compassed \add me\add* with gall and travail.
He hath set me in dark places , as \add they that be\add* dead of old.
He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out : he hath made my chain heavy.
Also when I cry and shout , he shutteth out my prayer.
He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone , he hath made my paths crooked.
He \add was\add* unto me \add as\add* a bear lying in wait , \add and as\add* a lion in secret places.
He hath turned aside my ways , and pulled me in pieces : he hath made me desolate.
He hath bent his bow , and set me as a mark for the arrow.
He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.\f + \fr 3.13 \ft arrows: Heb. sons\f*
I was a derision to all my people ; \add and\add* their song all the day.
He hath filled me with bitterness , he hath made me drunken with wormwood.\f + \fr 3.15 \ft bitterness: Heb. bitternesses\f*
He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones , he hath covered me with ashes.\f + \fr 3.16 \ft covered…: or, rolled me in the ashes\f*
And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace : I forgat prosperity.\f + \fr 3.17 \ft prosperity: Heb. good\f*
And I said , My strength and my hope is perished from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*:
Remembering mine affliction and my misery , the wormwood and the gall.\f + \fr 3.19 \ft Remembering: or, Remember\f*
My soul hath \add them\add* still in remembrance , and is humbled in me.\f + \fr 3.20 \ft humbled: Heb. bowed\f* \p
This I recall to my mind , therefore have I hope.\f + \fr 3.21 \ft recall…: Heb. make to return to my heart\f* \p
¶ \add It is of\add* the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* mercies that we are not consumed , because his compassions fail not.
\add They are\add* new every morning : great \add is\add* thy faithfulness.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* my portion , saith my soul ; therefore will I hope in him.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* good unto them that wait for him, to the soul \add that\add* seeketh him.
\add It is\add* good that \add a man\add* should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
\add It is\add* good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
He sitteth alone and keepeth silence , because he hath borne \add it\add* upon him.
He putteth his mouth in the dust ; if so be there may be hope.
He giveth \add his\add* cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.
For the Lord will not cast off for ever :
But though he cause grief , yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.\f + \fr 3.33 \ft willingly: Heb. from his heart\f*
To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth ,
To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High ,\f + \fr 3.35 \ft the most High: or, a superior\f*
To subvert a man in his cause , the Lord approveth not.\f + \fr 3.36 \ft approveth not: or, seeth not\f* \p
¶ Who \add is\add* he \add that\add* saith , and it cometh to pass, \add when\add* the Lord commandeth \add it\add* not?
Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good ?
Wherefore doth a living man complain , a man for the punishment of his sins ?\f + \fr 3.39 \ft complain: or, murmur\f*
Let us search and try our ways , and turn again to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Let us lift up our heart with \add our\add* hands unto God in the heavens. \p
We have transgressed and have rebelled : thou hast not pardoned.
Thou hast covered with anger , and persecuted us: thou hast slain , thou hast not pitied.
Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud , that \add our\add* prayer should not pass through.
Thou hast made us \add as\add* the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.
All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.
Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.
Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
Mine eye trickleth down , and ceaseth not, without any intermission ,
Till the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* look down , and behold from heaven.
Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.\f + \fr 3.51 \ft mine heart: Heb. my soul\f*\f + \fr 3.51 \ft because…: or, more than all\f*
Mine enemies chased me sore , like a bird , without cause.
They have cut off my life in the dungeon , and cast a stone upon me.
Waters flowed over mine head ; \add then\add* I said , I am cut off. \p
¶ I called upon thy name , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, out of the low dungeon.
Thou hast heard my voice : hide not thine ear at my breathing , at my cry.
Thou drewest near in the day \add that\add* I called upon thee: thou saidst , Fear not.
O Lord , thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul ; thou hast redeemed my life.
O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou hast seen my wrong : judge thou my cause.
Thou hast seen all their vengeance \add and\add* all their imaginations against me.
Thou hast heard their reproach , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add and\add* all their imaginations against me;
The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.
Behold their sitting down , and their rising up ; I \add am\add* their musick. \p
¶ Render unto them a recompence , O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to the work of their hands.
Give them sorrow of heart , thy curse unto them.\f + \fr 3.65 \ft sorrow…: or, obstinacy of heart\f*
Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
